title: ALTER BUDGET | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Fully qualified name: SNOWFLAKE.CORE.BUDGET
Modifies the properties of a custom budget:
Renames the budget.
Sets or unsets a tag.
Sets or unsets the comment.

CREATE BUDGET,
SHOW BUDGET,
DROP BUDGET
Specifies the identifier (i.e. name) of the budget.

If the identifier contains spaces or special characters, the entire string must be enclosed in double quotes.
Identifiers enclosed in double quotes are also case-sensitive.
For more information, see Identifier requirements.
Specifies one or more budget properties to be set.
Sets the comment of the budget. This can also be done using the COMMENT command.
Specifies the tag name and the tag string value.
The tag value is always a string, and the maximum number of characters for the tag value is 256.
For information about specifying tags in a statement, see Tag quotas for objects and columns.
Specifies one (or more) properties and/or parameters to unset for the budget, which resets them to the defaults:
COMMENT
TAG tag_name [ , tag_name ... ]

A role used to execute this SQL command must have the following
privileges at a minimum:
Privilege / Role
Object

Budget

The role used to modify the properties of a custom budget must be granted this
instance role.
The USAGE privilege on the parent database and schema are required to perform operations on any object in a schema.
For more information, see Budgets roles and privileges.
You can only modify the properties for a custom budget.
